name: Research Opportunity Program
description: This course provides a rewarding opportunity for students in their fourth year to undertake relatively advanced work in the research project of a professor in return for 499Y course credit. Participating faculty members post their project descriptions for the following summer and fall/winter sessions in early February and students are invited to apply in early March. See Experiential and International Opportunities for more details.
prerequisites: SOC221H5, 222H5, completion of at least 15.0 credits.
